summary: Dr. Robert Steven Hanley was charged with immoral and unprofessional conduct for engaging in sexual intercourse with a patient on three occasions shortly after performing surgery on her. Following the patient's pregnancy notification, Dr. Hanley prescribed an abortive medication. As a result, he received a reprimand, was placed on probation for a minimum of one year, mandated to enroll in the Maryland Professional Rehabilitation Program (MPRP), required to take an ethics course, and assessed a civil fine of $25,000.
